alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Aroostook County through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Frenchville to near New Canada to 7 miles northeast of Fish River Lake. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Frenchville, New Canada, Lille, Madawaska Lake, Cross Lake, New Sweden, Grand Isle, Connor, Perham, Caswell, Stockholm, Winterville, Hamlin, Westmanland, Sinclair, Daigle and Guerette. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Van Buren and Frenchville. State Highway 11 near Winterville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Maine.
